title: Understanding 360 Degree Feedback
headline: Benefit from this free online course that explores how organisations can implement 360 degree feedback.
description: 360 degree feedback is a process through which employees receive feedback from multiple sources - typically their peers, direct reports, and managers. This type of feedback can be very beneficial in helping employees identify areas for improvement and develop action plans to address those areas. However, 360 degree feedback can also be challenging to implement effectively. With this course, you will learn to make it a success.
courseDescription:
In this course, you will learn about 360 degree feedback. 360 degree feedback is a process where employees receive feedback from their managers, colleagues, and direct reports. This feedback can be used to improve performance and help employees reach their goals. 360 degree feedback is a valuable tool for any organisation that wants to improve its performance. If it can support the alignment of process and support change management initiative.

In this course, you will learn about the benefits of 360 degree feedback which include; helping employees understand their strengths and weaknesses, encouraging employees to set goals and improve their performance, providing employees with feedback from different perspectives and helping organisations identify training and development needs. You will also learn about 8 common performance appraisal systems including Ranking, Paired Comparisons, Critical Incident, Free-Form/Narrative, Self-Assessment, Assessment Centre, Performance and Rating.

You will also learn how to create a 360 degree feedback process which involves; identifying the participants, setting up the meeting, conducting the feedback session and following up after the feedback session. By the end of this course, you will have a better understanding of how 360 degree feedback can be used to improve your organisation's performance.
